New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the 1962 New York Mets for the modern major league record for losses with 120
Key Match Events: The White Sox put it away with a season-high seven runs in the fifth inning, helped by an error on shortstop Jack López.
Chris Flexen (3-15) struck out seven in 6 1/3 innings in his first win since May 8.
Tyler Anderson (10-15) permitted five runs, four earned, and four hits in 4 1/3 innings.
Pre-Game Insights: Interim manager Grady Sizemore said the team is excited after the series and is looking forward to competing against the Detroit Tigers.
First baseman Andrew Vaughn said the team has played good baseball in the last three games.
Post-Match Reflections: Catcher Logan O'Hoppe said the record is what it is and the team has a good group, but the record doesn't show it.
Manager Ron Washington said Nolan Schanuel could play this weekend after he fouled a ball off his right leg.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox finished their home schedule with a 23-58 record.
The Angels had six hits — five off Flexen and one off reliever.
Others: Chris Flexen was cheered by the crowd of 15,678 when he departed on a sunny afternoon.
The Angels dropped to 63-96 to set a franchise record for losses in a season.
